DOC.brief_summary: The aim study evaluate 18-month clinical performance multimode adhesive ( Scotchbond Universal Adhesive , 3M ESPE , St Paul , MN , USA ) primary molar partial carious removal . This randomized clinical trial include subject ( 5-10 year-old child ) select two university center ( UFSM FOUSP ) . The sample consist 132 primary molar present active cavitated carious lesion ( radiographic involvement outer half dentin ) , locate occlusal occlusal-proximal surface . The sample randomly divide two group accord bond approach : etch-and-rinse self-etch strategy . The restoration clinically follow every 6 month 18 month use USPHS modify criterion clinical evaluation . Survival estimate restoration longevity evaluate use Kaplan-Meier method .
DOC.brief_title: Performance Universal Adhesive Primary Molars : Randomized Clinical Trial
DOC.detailed_description: Randomized clinical trial performance universal adhesive primary molar
DOC.criteria: active carious lesion middle dentin limit occlusal occlusoproximal surface primary molar ; child ( male female ) good general health . child refuse fail cooperate completion clinical procedure ; teeth without antagonist ; carious lesion inner half dentin ; presence painful symptom sign pulpal change .
